decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Utilizing cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, you can create a fast and relentless attacking strategy. Supporting cards like Goblin Bombardment, Thraben Charm, and Galvanic Discharge add extra damage and removal options. The deck also includes control elements such as Static Prison and Blood Moon to disrupt your opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck focuses on being proactive and efficient in dealing damage to your opponent.

This deck aims to control the game by ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl, eventually casting powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It uses spells like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Return to clear the board and maintain control, while also utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble for removal and disruption. The deck's strategy revolves around ramping up quickly to overwhelm the opponent with large, game-ending threats while maintaining control over the battlefield.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with different effects to create a versatile toolbox that can be searched for and deployed using cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith. It aims to control the board with creatures like Wall of Roots and Young Wolf, while also generating value with options like Blood Artist and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician. By utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and combo pieces, the deck can adapt to different situations and disrupt opponents while building towards its win conditions.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes efficient counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Unearth. The deck also has ways to generate card advantage with Thought Scour and Cling to Dust. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and controlling the board, this Dimir Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to rapidly recur cards from the graveyard, enabling powerful combo interactions with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. By generating mana with Mox Amber and Urza's Saga, as well as controlling the board with cards like Malevolent Rumble and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to finish the game quickly with cards like Thassa's Oracle or by overwhelming the opponent with Grinding Station. The deck aims to create explosive plays by manipulating the graveyard and utilizing various combo interactions to outpace the opponent.

The deck aims to have a fast and explosive start by utilizing fast mana (such as Mox Amber and Mox Opal) to power out combo pieces. The main goal is to use Underworld Breach to loop through the graveyard, casting spells from exile, and eventually milling the opponent out with Grinding Station or winning with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes various ways to filter through the deck and protect the combo pieces, making it a resilient and powerful combo deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells and artifacts to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures. The key strategy is to control the board using spells like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command while also ramping up to play devastating creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while also disrupting their game plan with removal and control elements. It combines the ramp aspects of Eldrazi decks with the control elements to create a powerful and versatile strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures that can interact with each other to create powerful synergies and combos. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling, the deck can search for specific creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Blood Artist to create a toolbox of options to suit different situations. The deck also includes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to disrupt opponents' strategies and gain an advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by leveraging its creature synergies to control the board and win the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with fast creature drops and direct damage spells. It utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply pressure early on, while also having control elements like Static Prison and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to generate card advantage and Ocelot Pride for additional aggro potential. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive tactics, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively.

The key focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to control the tempo of the game by countering important spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. This deck uses a combination of efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus, along with powerful spells like Force of Negation and Fatal Push, to establish control over the game and eventually win through incremental advantage. The deck also utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Unearth and Thought Scour.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to control the board and deal damage to the opponent's life total. The key strategy is to apply early pressure with creatures like Guide of Souls and Orcish Bowmasters, while also disrupting the opponent's plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury can quickly close out games if left unchecked, and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides a powerful finisher. The deck also has some sacrifice synergies with Goblin Bombardment and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to generate value and clear opposing threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Goblin Bombardment, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Elegant Parlor to control the board and ensure victory. By combining fast creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides a powerful Planeswalker option, and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury can be a game-ending threat. The deck also includes disruption elements like Static Prison and Blood Moon to control the board and give the deck an advantage over the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to accelerate mana production and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while maintaining control of the board, ultimately leading to victory through powerful Eldrazi creatures and efficient removal spells.

This aggro Boros deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, backed up by disruptive cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm to provide additional removal and protection. The goal is to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the board to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using the powerful land ramp abilities of Amulet of Vigor and primeval Titan to quickly assemble the combo of bouncing lands with bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf to generate a large amount of mana and cast Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent. Dryad of the Ilysian Grove allows for multiple land drops per turn and the deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lotus Field to support the combo strategy. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a large amount of mana and powerful land-based threats.
